io.cettia.asity.bridge.servlet3

Class AsityServlet

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • io.cettia.asity.bridge.servlet3.AsityServlet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig

    public class AsityServlet
extends HttpServlet
    Servlet to process HttpServletRequest and HttpServletResponse into ServerHttpExchange. When you configure servlet, you must set asyncSupported to true . 

     Servlet servlet = new AsityServlet().onhttp(http -> {});
 ServletRegistration.Dynamic reg = context.addServlet(AsityServlet.class.getName(), servlet);
 reg.setAsyncSupported(true);
 reg.addMapping("/cettia");
    Author:
    Donghwan Kim
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
